Implementing author links. Since posts use `author` as a front matter field (not a taxonomy), creating a custom solution that:
1. Adds an authors taxonomy
2. Creates a custom taxonomy template that queries posts by the `author` field
3. Updates the single post template to link author names

Creating a PowerShell script to generate author pages from the authors data file, since Hugo taxonomies require terms in front matter:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: generate-author-pages.ps1</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 51, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,51 @@
- 
+ # Script to generate author pages from data/authors.yaml
+ # This creates markdown files in content/authors/ for each author
+ 
+ $authorsFile = &quot;data/authors.yaml&quot;
+ $outputDir = &quot;content/authors&quot;
+ 
+ # Create authors directory if it doesn&#39;t exist
+ if (-not (Test-Path $outputDir)) {
+     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $outputDir | Out-Null
+     Write-Host &quot;Created directory: $outputDir&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ # Read the authors YAML file
+ $content = Get-Content $authorsFile -Raw
+ 
+ # Parse YAML (simple parsing for this format)
+ $lines = Get-Content $authorsFile
+ $authors = @{}
+ 
+ foreach ($line in $lines) {
+     $line = $line.Trim()
+     # Skip comments and empty lines
+     if ($line -match &#39;^#|^\s*$&#39;) {
+         continue
+     }
+     # Match &quot;username: &quot;Display Name&quot;&quot;
+     if ($line -match &#39;^([^:]+):\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;&#39;) {
+         $username = $matches[1].Trim()
+         $displayName = $matches[2].Trim()
+         $authors[$username] = $displayName
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ # Generate a markdown file for each author
+ foreach ($username in $authors.Keys) {
+     $displayName = $authors[$username]
+     $filename = &quot;$outputDir/$username.md&quot;
+     
+     $frontMatter = @&quot;
+ +++
+ title = &quot;$displayName&quot;
+ slug = &quot;$username&quot;
+ +++
+ &quot;@
+     
+     Set-Content -Path $filename -Value $frontMatter
+     Write-Host &quot;Created: $filename&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nGenerated $($authors.Count) author pages in $outputDir&quot;
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+         {{ end }}
+     &lt;/header&gt;
+     
+     {{ if gt (len $authorPosts) 0 }}
+     &lt;div class=&quot;posts-list&quot;&gt;
+         {{ range $authorPosts }}
+         &lt;article class=&quot;post-item&quot;&gt;
+             &lt;a href=&quot;{{ .Permalink }}&quot;&gt;
+                 {{ if .Params.featuredImage }}
+                 &lt;div class=&quot;post-item-image&quot;&gt;
+                     &lt;img src=&quot;{{ .Params.featuredImage | relURL }}&quot; alt=&quot;{{ .Title }}&quot;&gt;
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+                 {{ end }}
+                 &lt;div class=&quot;post-item-content&quot;&gt;
+                     &lt;h2&gt;{{ .Title }}&lt;/h2&gt;
+                     {{ if .Date }}
+                     &lt;time datetime=&quot;{{ .Date.Format &quot;2006-01-02&quot; }}&quot;&gt;{{ .Date.Format &quot;January 2, 2006&quot; }}&lt;/time&gt;
+                     {{ end }}
+                     {{ if .Summary }}
+                     &lt;div class=&quot;post-excerpt&quot;&gt;{{ .Summary }}&lt;/div&gt;
+                     {{ else if .Description }}
+                     &lt;p class=&quot;post-excerpt&quot;&gt;{{ .Description }}&lt;/p&gt;
+                     {{ end }}
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+             &lt;/a&gt;
+         &lt;/article&gt;
+         {{ end }}
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+     {{ else }}
+     &lt;div class=&quot;list-description&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;p&gt;No articles found for this author.&lt;/p&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+     {{ end }}
+ &lt;/div&gt;
+ {{ end }}
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

## Summary

1. **Added authors taxonomy** to `hugo.toml` (for future use, though we're using content pages now)

2. **Created author pages** — Generated markdown files in `content/authors/` for each author from `data/authors.yaml`

3. **Created author layouts**:
   - `themes/majority/layouts/authors/single.html` — Displays all posts by a specific author
   - `themes/majority/layouts/authors/list.html` — Lists all authors (for `/authors/`)

4. **Updated single post template** — Modified `themes/majority/layouts/_default/single.html` to link author names to their author pages

5. **Added CSS styling** — Added styles for `.article-byline` and `.author-link` in the theme's CSS

## How it works

- Clicking an author name on any post (e.g., "Mark Devlin") links to `/authors/sparkzilla/`
- The author page lists all posts by that author, sorted by date (newest first)
- The permalink structure is `/authors/:slug/` as configured in `hugo.toml`

The author links are now functional. When you build or serve your Hugo site, clicking an author name will take you to a page listing all their articles.
